title: Coronation Street spoilers: Sinead dies and David stabbing horror
text:
Dramatic events and emotional farewells are at the centre of our latest Coronation Street spoilers as the soap prepares for one of its biggest weeks of the year, as David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) finds himself caught up in a horrifying prison riot, and Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn) prepares to bid farewell to her loved ones, as she dies in heartbreaking scenes.

Meanwhile, Bethany Platt (Lucy Fallon) finds herself faced with an emotional dilemma, and Max makes a shocking discovery about David, as Shona Ramsey (Julia Goulding) questions what she thinks she knows.

10 Corrie spoilers Beth, Kirk and Craig plan to celebrate Christmas early with Sinead

David and Josh come face-to-face during a violent prison riot

Daniel’s overprotectiveness causes friction between him and Sinead

Max makes amends for his behaviour towards Shona

Josh is stabbed in prison

Bethany and Daniel share a moment

Peter and Carla return from Italy

Sinead discovers Bethany’s notebook

Shona’s unsure what to believe following the riot

Sinead dies

Monday 21st October Part One

A riot breaks out in prison and David retreats to his cell, but things are made complicated when Abe brings Josh into said cell and — handing him a pair a scissors — gives David ample opportunity to do as he pleases with his rapist. Will he take revenge?

Kirk, Beth and Craig surprise Sinead by having an impromptu Christmas celebration, and she’s thrilled as a result. However, Daniel’s overprotectiveness poses a risk to the meal running smoothly, as he thinks Sinead simply isn’t up to such a thing — and conflict ensues as a result.

Monday 21st October Part Two

With tensions running high, David informs Abe that he wishes to deal with Josh alone, as he ponders whether or not to seek revenge for what the rapist did to him. News of the riot reaches the Platt household via the news, and David rings Shona to tell her that Josh has been stabbed — and that she’d better get him a lawyer.

Bethany spots an emotional Daniel and tries to cheer him up. However, he breaks down in her arms, confessing that he wishes he could change the situation that both he and Sinead have found themselves in. Bethany embraces him —something which Ken spies, and he orders his son to return home to his dying wife.

Wednesday 23rd October Part One

Bethany can’t stop thinking about the moment she shared with Daniel, and thus reveals to Audrey that she’s in love with him, but she can’t stop blaming herself for taking advantage.

Advertisement

Meanwhile, Sinead searches for her notebook, but stumbles upon Bethany’s instead — and proceeds to read her short story.Sinead confronts Daniel, claiming that it’s pretty obvious that Bethany’s in love with him. Daniel refutes such a claim, but Sinead knows there’s more to this than meets the eye, and thus begs him to be honest with her.

Meanwhile, David claims to have had no involvement in the attack on Josh, but Max uncovers some evidence that would seemingly suggest otherwise — leaving Shona in shock.

Wednesday 23rd October Part Two

Daniel swears to Sinead that what happened between him and Bethany meant nothing, but Sinead’s not so sure, and she struggles to make eye contact with him as a result. Dr Gaddas tends to Sinead and informs her that regardless of what transpired with Daniel, she is loved.

Daniel enters self-destruct mode, leaving Adam to pick up the peaces, while an enraged Craig confronts Bethany over her recent actions.

David is horrified when he hears that Max has seen the video of the prison riot, and he professes his innocence once more. However, Shona’s not really sure what to make.

Thursday 24th October

Sinead’s upset when she wakes up and realises that Daniel’s not there. Beth helps her to record some messages for Bertie to show her son just how much she loves him — thus preparing for a future that she won’t be a part of.

Tracy gaves Sinead some words of wisdom about Daniel, and manages to convince her that — in addition to the fact that Bertie’s going to need his dad — Daniel loves her more than anything.

Advertisement

Friday 25th October Part One

Sinead berates Daniel and urges him to stop punishing himself over what’s transpired. Dr Gaddas arrives to check on Sinead, but it becomes apparent that she’s simply too ill to move to a hospice — making Daniel realise just how little time he has left with his wife.

Sinead later takes comfort in hearing her family argue over silly things and, later when they’ve left, she spends some quality time with Daniel.

Elsewhere, Gail returns from Thailand to find Sally and Tracy having a go at Bethany in the street.

Friday 25th October Part Two

With Daniel and Bertie by her side, Sinead passes away peacefully.

Both the Barlow and Tinker clans congregate in the Rovers and await the news of Sinead, as they share their favourite memories of the young woman.
